intro: Gossypium auritum, commonly known as the ear-shaped cotton plant, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive ear-shaped leaves. The plant produces fluffy, white fibers that are harvested for textile use, similar to other cotton species. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, preferring well-drained soils and full sunlight. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and agricultural contexts.
